findings.Liver: Diffuse dropout of liver signal compatible with hepatic steatosis, fat fraction is 2%. Millimetric mildly T2 hyperintense lesion in segment 7 likely a hemangioma.
findings.Biliary: Intra and extrahepatic bile ducts are normal caliber. Small gallstone identified in the gallbladder. Small amount of pericholecystic fluid noted.
findings.Pancreas: Homogeneous signal throughout. Pancreatic duct is not dilated.
findings.Adrenal Glands: Right adrenal gland is unremarkable. 0.6 cm nodular thickening of the lateral limb of left adrenal gland likely benign.
findings.Kidneys: Millimetric T2 hyperintense lesion in the upper pole left kidney compatible with a renal cyst. No hydronephrosis.
findings.Gastrointestinal Tract: Stomach is unremarkable. Small and large bowel loops are normal caliber.
findings.Osseous and Soft Tissue Structures: No suspicious bone or soft tissue lesion identified.
